summary: Apply your knowledge of dragon smithing to create better glass armor and weapons!
descriptionHtml:
Once you know how to work with glass and then learn the secrets of dragonscale, you can apply those techniques to create advanced glass armor and weapons -- the weight of glass, but the protective qualities of dragonscale and the damage-dealing capabilities of ebony!

Characters with both the Glass and Dragon Smithing perks will find advanced glass in the Glass category at the Forge; they require the same materials as glass, and can be improved on the workbench just like glass.

The \"Plus\" version requires additional materials to smith (dragon scales and iron for armor, dragon bones for weapons), and to temper (dragon scales for armor, and dragon bones for weapons).

To-do:
 * [Maybe] Include custom meshes and textures (if there\'s enough interest, and I can find a willing contributor -- I\'m a code, I\'m no 3D artist, a simple recoloring is pushing my skills!), or alternatively release a version that points to different meshes and textures so that users can install their choice.
author: Kromey

files.name: Advanced Glass Armor
files.changelogHtml:
Initial release
Advanced glass armor protects like dragonscale, but looks like glass

files.name: Advanced Glass
files.changelogHtml:
Added advanced glass weapons (in a separate file)
Added optional \"plus\" version that requires additional smithing and tempering materials
Advanced glass weapons have equivalent damage as ebony

files.name: Advanced Glass - Plus
files.changelogHtml:
Added advanced glass weapons (in a separate file)
Added optional \"plus\" version that requires additional smithing and tempering materials
Advanced glass weapons have equivalent damage as ebony
